headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Skyworks, Qualcomm, Lilly, Honeywell, Ford, Roblox, Peloton, Amazon, and More
summary: Skyworks says its share of the business to supply Apple will fall and cut into revenue, Qualcomm tumbles after earnings, Eli Lilly stock rises on upbeat guidance, and Ford Motor’s operating profit forecast disappoints. Honeywell, meanwhile, announces a plan to break up into three companies.

Honeywell, meanwhile, announces a plan to break up into three companies.

headline: Skyworks Hits Roadblock With Apple Content Loss, Analysts See Tough Road For Recovery
summary: Skyworks Solutions, Inc. (NASDAQ:SWKS) shares are trading lower on Thursday. Yesterday, the company reported quarterly financial results and announced a CEO transition. Skyworks expects second-quarter revenue to be between $935 million and $965 million, and adjusted earnings of $1.20 per share. Here are the analysts’ take on the stock: Stifel analyst Ruben Roy downgraded Skyworks to Hold from Buy, lowering the price forecast to $62 from $105. headline: Why Skyworks Solutions (SWKS) Shares Are Sliding Today
summary: Shares of wireless chips maker Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ: SWKS) fell 30% in the pre-market session after the company reported underwhelming fourth-quarter results and announced it lost some of its business with its largest customer, Apple. Sales came in roughly in line with Wall Street expectations but declined 11.1% year-on-year​. SWKS confirmed a significant loss of business in the upcoming iPhone 17 cycle, as management disclosed that the company will be dual-sourced for the iPhone 17 DRX so

headline: Roblox, Skyworks, Honeywell: Market Minute
summary: In today's Market Minute, host Madison Mills highlights the top stock movers on Yahoo Finance. Roblox (RBLX) stock plummeted after reporting fourth quarter results that showed a drop in daily active users during the quarter. Honeywell (HON) has announced a restructuring with plans to split into three distinct entities: one focused on advanced materials, another on aerospace, and the third dedicated to automation units. Skyworks Solutions (SWKS) saw its shares tumble following warnings about intensifying competition in the smartphone market. The company suggested this could lead to an overall decline in sales. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: Skyworks under pressure, chip competition intensifies
summary: Shares of semiconductor producer Skyworks Solutions (SWKS) are under pressure after the company forecast a decline in revenue for the first quarter due to increased competition in the smartphone chip market. Catalysts hosts Madison Mills and Seana Smith discuss the details. Skyworks predicts a drop in business from Apple (AAPL), one of Skyworks's biggest customers. Apple's shift in supplier relationships comes in the wake of semiconductor competitor Qualcomm (QCOM) seeing growth in smartphone chip revenue, raising concerns for Skyworks, especially amid geopolitical impacts on the chip industry. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Josh Lynch

headline: Skyworks Q1 Earnings Top Estimates: Will 2Q25 Outlook Drag Shares Down?
summary: SWKS' fiscal first-quarter results reflect strong mobile growth, offset by high inventory, uneven demand, and muted recovery in automotive and industrial markets.
